page.title: 08ST.MICHAELS AND ALL ANGELS
page.content: The church of St.Michael and All Angels was built to the order of Robert Smith of Goldings in 1871-2. All the oak used in the construction of the church was cut from trees growing within the Goldings estate. Constructed of Kentish Rag, cornered with dressed Bath stone, the church is built in the style of Early English Gothic. The stained glass windows are particularly fine. The most noteworthy are those on the south wall by Sir Alfred Burne-Jones depicting the prophetess Miriam & King David. The East window, consisting of three lights with medallions above, is the work of Burne-Jones, Dante-Gabriel Rossetti and William Morris. ----continued on page 9-------
